intro: Harpalyce alba, commonly known as white harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, compound leaves. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Harpalyce alba is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils in arid environments.
